justification: The methods state that personality was assessed with a survey cited as Soto & John, 2017, which is the Big Five Inventory-2.
Participants completed a survey that assessed their political ideologies, referenced to Inbar, Pizarro, & Bloom, 2009.
The text notes that values were measured with a survey cited to Lindeman & Verkasalo, 2005, the Short Schwartz’s Value Survey.
Empathy was assessed with a survey attributed to Davis, 1983, i.e., the Interpersonal Reactivity Index.
Numeracy measurement cites Cokely et al., 2012, which developed the Berlin Numeracy Test.
The numeracy assessment also cites Fagerlin et al., 2007, the origin of the Subjective Numeracy Scale.
Moral foundations were surveyed using the instrument from Graham, Haidt, & Nosek, 2009, the Moral Foundations Questionnaire.
Moral commitments were assessed with a survey referenced to Lombrozo, 2009, which provides a scale for moral commitments.
